metadata.Title: CVE-2023-23942 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Nextcloud Desktop Client is a tool to synchronize files from aNextcloud Server with your computer. Versions prior to 3.6.3 are missingsanitisation on qml labels which are used for basic HTML elements such as`strong`, `em` and `head` lines in the UI of the desktop client. The lackof sanitisation may allow for javascript injection. It is recommended thatthe Nextcloud Desktop Client is upgraded to 3.6.3. There are no knownworkarounds for this issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23942` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

caja-nextcloud - 3.7.0-2
dolphin-nextcloud - 3.7.0-2
libnextcloudsync0 - 3.7.0-2
nautilus-nextcloud - 3.7.0-2
nemo-nextcloud - 3.7.0-2
nextcloud-desktop - 3.7.0-2
nextcloud-desktop-cmd - 3.7.0-2
nextcloud-desktop-common - 3.7.0-2
nextcloud-desktop-l10n - 3.7.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nextcloud-desktop package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.7.0-2').
